message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about Chinese named entity recognition using neural networks, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a unified framework for joint training with word segmentation, which involves machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The neural architecture used in the paper, CNN-LSTM-CRF, is a deep learning model, which falls under the category of machine learning and can be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also deals with the problem of insufficient training data, which is a common issue in NLP, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for generating pseudo labeled samples, which involves information retrieval techniques, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another possible sub-category.
